ing: 1/2 cup white wine, or more to taste
4 (3 ounce) fillets amberjack, dark brown vein removed
1 tablespoon mayonnaise, or more to taste
2 teaspoons seafood seasoning (such as Old BayÂ®), or to taste
des: "We go deep-sea fishing each spring when the kids get out of school for spring break. I only have a couple of ways to cook amberjack aside from frying (which we do not eat a lot of).  This recipe has minimal ingredients and is super easy. You can season some pieces more heavily than others depending on everyone's taste."
ins:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Pour wine into a glass baking dish. Arrange amberjack fillets on top. Coat with a very thin layer of mayonnaise. Sprinkle seafood seasoning over mayonnaise coating.
Bake in the preheated oven until amberjack flakes easily with a fork, 20 to 30 minutes.
